abstract.text: The
class provides a base class for custom input controller classes. The

class, which is allocated in the main function of an input method, creates an input controller object for each input session created by a client application. For every input session there is a corresponding
object.

inlineContent.text: object controls text input on the input method side. It manages events and text from the applications and converted text from the input method engine.
protocols.  Typically you do not need to override this class, but you do need to provide  a delegate object that implements the methods that your are interested in.  The
versions of the protocol methods check whether the delegate object implements a method, and  calls the delegate version if it exists.

abstract.text: Develop input methods and manage communication with client applications, candidates windows, and input method modes.
The
class presents candidates to users and notifies the appropriate
object when the user selects a candidate.
are alternate characters for a given input sequence. The
class supports using a candidates window  in your input method; using
is optional. Not all input methods require them.
The
class provides a base class for custom input controller classes. The

class, which is allocated in the main function of an input method, creates an input controller object for each input session created by a client application. For every input session there is a corresponding
object.
Sends the selected candidate string and annotation string to the input controller.
Stops the current composition and replaces marked text with the original text.
Informs an input controller that a new candidate is selected.
Informs an input controller that the current candidate selection in the candidate window has changed.
Returns the client object associated with the input controller.
Returns a dictionary of text attributes.
Returns the delegate for input controller  object.
Passes commands that are not generated as part of the text input process.
Informs an input method that it should  close any visible user interface.
Initializes the input control by setting the delegate.
Returns a dictionary of text attributes that can mark a range of an attributed string to send to a client.
Returns a menu of commands that are specific to an input method.
Returns the range in the client document that the text should replace.
Returns where the range of the selection that should be placed inside marked text.
Returns the server object that manages the input controller.
Sets the delegate for input controller  object.
Informs the input controller that the composition has changed.
The
protocol defines methods that your input method can implement to handle mouse events.
The
class manages client connections to your input method.  When you write the main function for your input method, you create an
object.  You should never need to override this class.
The
protocol defines methods for setting or accessing values that indicate the state of an input method.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
